snippet: Jurors in the trial of Blackwater contractors in a 2007 shooting in Iraq asked the judge whether a firearm charge applied to defendants convicted of involuntary manslaughter.
abstract: Jurors in trial of four former Blackwater Worldwide security contractors in a 2007 shooting in Iraq ask the judge whether a firearm charge applies to defendants convicted of involuntary manslaughter; jurors' note hints at conviction.
lead_paragraph: Jurors in the trial of Blackwater contractors in a 2007 shooting in Iraq asked the judge whether a firearm charge applied to defendants convicted of involuntary manslaughter.

headline.main: Jurors’ Note Hints at Conviction in Blackwater Case
headline.print_headline: Verdict May Be Near in Killing of Iraqis
